alert.note: Alert for Amherst; Appomattox; Buckingham (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 5:13PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Appomattox, southwestern Buckingham and east central Amherst Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 513 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Riverville, or near Amherst, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Amherst... Bent Creek... Clifford... Riverville... New Glasgow... Wingina... and Tower Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central, south central and west central Virginia.
